intro: Lasianthus palawanensis, commonly known as the Palawan flame tree, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its striking red or orange-red flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has lance-shaped leaves and produces small, woody fruits that contain seeds. It is typically found in lowland areas and is valued for its ornamental beauty. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
